content.description: Follow the obvious crack up the "Babyface" slab
content.location: Just below the Coney Rock outlook. This wall has been called the "Babyface" or warmup slab

climbs.name: Sternin'
climbs.fa: not sure, had chalk the bottom

content.description: Crux is probably the third move. The moves aren't too hard or scary.
content.location: Mulberry Road a mile up past where it meets up with chaffeeville. You'll see a place to park with a boulder. Go across the street to the other parking place. Go in the woods and follow the rocks up the hill until just before a short ridge.

content.description: Start on the far left just right of the small tree, traverse right along the ledge around until you get to the high point, then top out. fun low ball warm up.
content.location: squatty boulder facing horseshit & skunk cabbage in the proposal rock area

content.description: Campus Start from the jug shown at the bottom of the pic, then get a left heel hook on the opposite side of the rock, and a right heel hook near your right hand. Move left to the first hold shown, then advance your right heel closer to the starting jug and cross your right to a big jug shown as the next hold.  Then match on this, adjust your feet, and reach over the top and to the opposite side of the rock to another jug with your right, then pull/push your body around to the top of the prow.
content.protection: Bring a pad, if you fall you're going to be sideways/upside down.

content.description: Start with one hand in both obvious cracks. Continue up the right crack using a feature under the overhang as a foothold. Hit a pinch at the top of the arete and make a big move to a nice finishing jug to the left.
content.location: Located on what I believe to be Proposal Rock. Park at the trailhead at the end of Woodland Rd. and hike a couple minutes down the Mullane Trail.

content.description: Start matched in a finger crack with very sparse feet. Thow up to a slopey jug and traverse up the left leaning rail using slopers and crimps with a solid heel hook.
content.location: Located on the left face of one of the first large boulders when coming from the pullout on Mulberry Road towards Coney Rock.

content.description: Anyone, please correct me if these rocks/problems are already known, I couldn't find anything in any guidebooks or online.  There is a main rock face with some shorter sections and outcrops (10-20 ft.) at the Coney Rock Overlook, and a few erratics to the north east on the Mullane Trail called Proposal Rocks.  I believe all the rock here is gneiss, and is similar to the rest of the rock you'll find in the mansfield area (e.g. Wolf Rock and Pot Hole) The trail is sparsely traveled, I normally only see people on the weekends hiking to enjoy the sight off of the Coney Rock overlook.  Also, the area also known as "Mulberry Boulders" off of Mulberry Rd. is made of the scattered boulders between the main overlook and Mulberry Rd. below.  This area has more/better problems with photos soon to come.
